460: Position Title: Product Development Scientist, Agriculture Position Summary: With a legacy in silicones and advanced materials that spans more than 75 years, Momentive was the first company to introduce organosilicones for agricultural applications. Our adjuvants and additives play a pivotal role in enabling farmers to grow more food sustainably, reducing water usage and improving the effectiveness of agricultural treatments. We are seeking a talented individual to join our team and build upon this legacy by developing the next generation of Silwet™ and AgroSpred™ products. As part of our diverse team, you will work closely with customers, sales, and marketing to identify current market needs and define project targets. You will use your expertise in synthetic chemistry, surface science, and agricultural adjuvant formulations and application technologies to design, develop, and commercialize new market driven technologies. Additionally, you will collaborate with internal functions such as manufacturing, quality, and product stewardship to ensure the successful launch of these exciting new products. Job Description: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Synthesize, formulate and evaluate new products for the Agriculture market, independently designing and carrying out experiments, including DOEs Lead, plan and execute product development projects, from definition of customer needs through assistance with the scale-up and commercialization of new materials Closely collaborate with global product and application development teams as well as with marketing and business functions to ensure that projects are aligned globally and meet customer/market needs Clearly communicate results of program activities through written reports and presentations including internal and external conferences and publications. Run chemical analysis and physical characterization in collaboration with our analytical team Conduct performance testing with application scientists and advance the understanding of application mechanisms Follow the marketing and technology trends in sustainable adjuvants; conduct IP and literature reviews; write invention disclosures Collaborate on spray trial protocols to validate the performance of products in development Organize and share laboratory research data using Microsoft 365 and Electronic Lab Notebooks TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: Domestic travel may be required based on the business needs (approx. 10%) PRIMARY LOCATION: Tarrytown, NY but expected to move to Pearl River, NY in late Q2, 2023 PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, bend, stoop, crouch, twist, turn, lift, and move about the facility. Walking, walking on irregular surfaces, and balancing will be required. Reaching, feeling, finger movement, grasping, hearing, sight, and the ability to speak clearly will be required. Regularly lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs. The ability to wear personal protective equipment, and the ability to pass a fit test and wear a respirator is required for most positions. The environment for this position is a laboratory setting. Candidates should be able to adapt to a traditional business environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Additional Details: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Demonstrated industrial or academic experience in organic or polymer synthesis, chemical analysis, and physical property characterization. Demonstrated understanding of structure – property relationship and the ability to design new molecular structures based on performance needs. Proven record of safe laboratory operations, design of experiments, and statistical analysis. Ph.D. Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or related field. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Industrial experience in the synthesis of surfactants or functional polymers. Familiar with surface chemistry and rheology science.
